item.title: cosmological redshift
item.description: Redshift caused by the expansion of the universe. This comes about because wavelengths increase as radiation travels through expanding space.

item.title: peculiar velocity
item.description: The components of an object’s velocity that deviate from [[Hubble’s law]]. e.g. due to gravitational attraction to other galaxies in a cluster.

item.title: Zone of Avoidance
item.description: A band around the sky in which very few galaxies are seen. This is due to obstruction by interstellar dust.
